name: Dosa
description: A crispy, savory crepe made from fermented rice and lentil batter, typically served with chutney and sambar.

name: Idli
description: Soft, steamed rice cakes made from fermented batter, perfect for breakfast or as a light meal.

name: Sambar
description: A hearty lentil-based vegetable stew flavored with tamarind and aromatic spices.

name: Vada
description: Crispy, savory doughnut-shaped fritters made from lentil batter, often served as a snack or side dish.

name: Pongal
description: A comforting rice and lentil dish cooked with ghee, black pepper, and cumin, often served during festivals.

name: Rasam
description: A tangy, spicy soup made with tamarind juice, tomatoes, and various spices, known for its digestive properties.

name: Appam
description: Lacy, bowl-shaped rice pancakes with crispy edges and a soft center, typically served with stew or curry.

name: Bisi Bele Bath
description: A flavorful, spicy rice dish made with lentils, vegetables, and aromatic spices, originating from Karnataka.

name: Chettinad Chicken Curry
description: A fiery, aromatic chicken curry from the Chettinad region, known for its complex blend of spices.

name: Payasam
description: A sweet, creamy dessert made with milk, rice or vermicelli, and flavored with cardamom and nuts.
